official_title: A bill to amend title 18 of the United States Code to provide extended coverage for the minimum mandatory penalties for certain illegal uses of firearms, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Firearms Mandatory Sentencing Act of 1980 - Amends the Federal criminal code with respect to the additional sentences imposed for using or carrying a firearm while committing a felony to: (1) extend the sentencing restrictions currently applicable to second and subsequent offenses to first offenses; and (2) add to such restrictions that a person shall not be eligible for parole until one-half of his term of imprisonment has expired. Directs the President to appoint a commission to study the effectiveness of current State laws in preventing crimes committed by firearms.
